page.title: 10KEWSTOKE SCHOOL IN 1985
page.content: Kewstoke school is a small school and it is set on the side of Worlebury Hill. There are about 90 children in the school and only three classrooms, two in the main building which is old and made of stone. There is a hut used by the older juniors. In the main building between the two classrooms is the middle room which is used for assembly, singing, dinners and watching television. Behind the hut is the school's woodland and most of the pupils do projects on it. The school has a Computer and a video and they are useful to the school. There are two playgrounds - a grassy one and a hard one. There are a lot of clubs at the school such as Book club, Recorder, Guitar, Art club, soft Tennis, Volley ball, Hockey and Football.
